biography.title: Biography
biography.subtitle: The Journey of a Visionary Leader
biography.earlyLifeContent: Donald John Trump was born on June 14, 1946, in Queens, New York City. He graduated from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania with a degree in economics.
biography.businessCareerContent: Before entering politics, Trump built a renowned business empire as a real estate developer and businessman. He developed numerous iconic properties across New York City and beyond.
biography.politicalCareerContent: Trump's political journey culminated in his election as the 45th President of the United States in 2016, and again as the 47th President in 2024, making him the second president to serve non-consecutive terms.

economy.title: Economic Growth
economy.content: Tax cuts, deregulation, and pro-business policies that drove unprecedented economic growth and job creation.

immigration.title: Immigration Reform
immigration.content: Securing borders, reforming immigration systems, and prioritizing American citizens.

foreignPolicy.title: America First Foreign Policy
foreignPolicy.content: Putting American interests first in international relations while promoting peace through strength.

trade.title: Fair Trade
trade.content: Renegotiating trade deals to ensure fair terms for American workers and businesses.

about.title: About This Site
about.subtitle: Celebrating American Leadership
about.content: This website is dedicated to honoring the legacy and vision of President Donald J. Trump and his commitment to the American people. Here, we celebrate the achievements and policies that have shaped the nation.
